intro: Salacicratea ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's salacious vine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Salicaceae, which includes willows and poplars, though it is more closely related to the genus Salacia. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a glossy green surface. Its flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and clustered in axillary inflorescences, while its fruits are follicles containing several seeds. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
